definition: to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate

sentences.english: We have bred six bitches to him.
sentences.chinese: 我们有六只母犬与之配种。

sentences.english: Wild boar estrus none seasonally and mate all the year.
sentences.chinese: 公野猪发情无季节性，可以常年配种。

sentences.english: Because of these pigs two days OK hybridization.
sentences.chinese: 因为这些猪两天就可以配种一次。

sentences.english: The reproductive organs of the dairy cow have the most direct impact on breeding pen performance.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛的生殖器官对于配种枪的操作有最直接的影响。

sentences.english: Forced copulation has practical value in organizing modernized mass production in rabbits-breeding.
sentences.chinese: 此强迫配种方法在组织现代化同步生产上有实用价值。

sentences.english: Artificial insemination was applied to the bactrian camel breeding.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼配种采用人工授精。

sentences.english: The objective of the feeding program immediately before mating is to maximize the number of eggs ovulated .
sentences.chinese: 在临近配种时饲喂程序的目标是促使排卵数最大化。

definition: to give birth (animals)/to bear a litter
the breeding season (zool.)/oestrus (period of sexual receptivity of female mammals)
(of animals) to give birth/to foal, to whelp etc
variant of 仔豬|仔猪[zi3 zhu1]
